30class OpihiManualWindow(QtWidgets.QMainWindow): 

31 """The GUI that is responsible for interaction between the user and the 

32 two Opihi solutions, the image (OpihiPreprocessSolution) and the 

33 results (OpihiSolution). 

34 

35 Only non-GUI attributes are listed here. 

36 

37 Attributes 

38 ---------- 

39 asteroid_set_name : string 

40 The current asteroid name provided by the user. 

41 raw_fits_filename : string 

42 The raw input filename. This file is usually preprocessed before 

43 analysis. 

44 raw_record_filename : string 

45 The raw MPC record filename. This contains historical asteroid 

46 information collected (with the unique identifier being the name). 

47 process_fits_filename : string 

48 The filename of the preprocessed image, this is generally generated 

49 automatically by the preprocess solution. This file is generally used 

50 for analysis. 

51 automatic_fetch_directory : string 

52 The directory where fits files are to be automatically fetched from. 

53 Getting a file using the manual method updates this to the directory 

54 of the manual file. 

55 preprocess_solution : OpihiPreprocessSolution 

56 The preprocessing solution which is used to convert raw images to 

57 preprocessed files. 

58 opihi_solution : OpihiSolution 

59 The general OpihiExarata solution, the collection class of all other 

60 solutions. 

61 """ 

62 

63 def __init__(self) -> None: 

64 """The manual GUI window for OpihiExarata. This interacts directly 

65 with the total solution object of Opihi. 

66 

67 Parameters 

68 ---------- 

69 None 

70 

71 Returns 

72 ------- 

73 None 

74 """ 

75 # Creating the GUI itself using the Qt framework and the converted 

76 # Qt designer files. 

77 super(OpihiManualWindow, self).__init__() 

78 self.ui = gui.qtui.Ui_ManualWindow() 

79 self.ui.setupUi(self) 

80 

81 # Establishing the defaults for all of the relevant attributes. 

82 self.asteroid_set_name = None 

83 self.raw_fits_filename = None 

84 self.raw_record_filename = None 

85 self.process_fits_filename = None 

86 self.automatic_fetch_directory = None 

87 self.preprocess_solution = None 

88 self.opihi_solution = None 

89 

90 # The automatic fetching directory default is stored in the 

91 # configuration file. 

92 AF_DIR = library.config.GUI_MANUAL_INITIAL_AUTOMATIC_IMAGE_FETCHING_DIRECTORY 

93 if os.path.isdir(AF_DIR): 

94 self.automatic_fetch_directory = AF_DIR 

95 else: 

96 self.automatic_fetch_directory = None 

97 

98 # Preparing the image area for Opihi sky images. 

99 self.__init_opihi_image() 

100 

101 # Preparing the buttons, GUI, and other functionality. 

102 self.__init_gui_connections() 

103 

104 # Preparing the preprocessing solution so that the raw files loaded 

105 # into Exarata can be instantly turned into reduced images. 

106 self.__init_preprocess_solution() 

107 

108 # All done. 

109 return None 

110

112 """Assign the action bindings for the buttons which get new 

113 file(names). 

114 

115 Parameters 

116 ---------- 

117 None 

118 

119 Returns 

120 ------- 

121 None 

122 """ 

123 # The new file and new object buttons. 

124 self.ui.push_button_new_image_automatic.clicked.connect( 

125 self.__connect_push_button_new_image_automatic 

126 ) 

127 self.ui.push_button_new_image_manual.clicked.connect( 

128 self.__connect_push_button_new_image_manual 

129 ) 

130 self.ui.push_button_new_target.clicked.connect( 

131 self.__connect_push_button_new_target 

132 ) 

133 

134 # The window and plot refresh button. 

135 self.ui.push_button_refresh_window.clicked.connect( 

136 self.__connect_push_button_refresh_window 

137 ) 

138

140 self.ui.push_button_astrometry_solve_astrometry.clicked.connect( 

141 self.__connect_push_button_astrometry_solve_astrometry 

142 ) 

143 self.ui.push_button_astrometry_custom_solve.clicked.connect( 

144 self.__connect_push_button_astrometry_custom_solve 

145 ) 

146 

147 # Photometry-specific buttons. 

148 self.ui.push_button_photometry_solve_photometry.clicked.connect( 

149 self.__connect_push_button_photometry_solve_photometry 

150 ) 

151

153 self.ui.push_button_orbit_solve_orbit.clicked.connect( 

154 self.__connect_push_button_orbit_solve_orbit 

155 ) 

156 

157 # Ephemeris-specific buttons. 

158 self.ui.push_button_ephemeris_solve_ephemeris.clicked.connect( 

159 self.__connect_push_button_orbit_solve_ephemeris 

160 ) 

161 

162 # Propagate-specific buttons. 

163 self.ui.push_button_propagate_solve_propagation.clicked.connect( 

164 self.__connect_push_button_propagate_solve_propagation 

165 ) 

166 self.ui.push_button_propagate_custom_solve.clicked.connect( 

167 self.__connect_push_button_propagate_custom_solve 

168 )

170 def __init_opihi_image(self) -> None: 

171 """Create the image area which will display what Opihi took from the 

172 sky. This takes advantage of a reserved image vertical layout in the 

173 design of the window. 

174 

175 Parameters 

176 ---------- 

177 None 

178 

179 Returns 

180 ------- 

181 None 

182 """ 

183 # Deriving the size of the image from the filler dummy image. The 

184 # figure should be a square. (Height really is the primary concern.) 

185 pix_to_in = lambda p: p / plt.rcParams["figure.dpi"] 

186 dummy_edge_size = self.ui.dummy_opihi_image.height() 

187 edge_size = pix_to_in(dummy_edge_size) 

188 # The figure, canvas, and navigation toolbar of the image plot 

189 # using a Matplotlib Qt widget backend. We will add these to the 

190 # layout later. 

191 fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(edge_size, edge_size), constrained_layout=True) 

192 self.opihi_figure = fig 

193 self.opihi_axes = ax 

194 self.opihi_canvas = FigureCanvas(self.opihi_figure) 

195 self.opihi_nav_toolbar = NavigationToolbar(self.opihi_canvas, self) 

196 

197 # For ease of usage, a custom navigation bar coordinate formatter 

198 # function/class is used. 

199 class CoordinateFormatter: 

200 """A simple function class to properly format the navigation bar 

201 coordinate text. This assumes the current structure of the GUI.""" 

202 

203 def __init__(self, gui_instance: OpihiManualWindow) -> None: 

204 self.gui_instance = gui_instance 

205 return None 

206 

207 def __call__(self, x, y) -> str: 

208 """The coordinate string going to be put onto the navigation 

209 bar.""" 

210 # The pixel locations. 

211 x_index = int(x) 

212 y_index = int(y) 

213 x_coord_string = "{x_int:d}".format(x_int=x_index) 

214 y_coord_string = "{y_int:d}".format(y_int=y_index) 

215 # Extracting the data. 

216 try: 

217 z_float = self.gui_instance.opihi_solution.data[y_index, x_index] 

218 except AttributeError: 

219 # There is no data to index. 

220 z_coord_string = "NaN" 

221 else: 

222 # Parse the string from the number provided. 

223 z_coord_string = "{z_flt:.2f}".format(z_flt=z_float) 

224 

225 # Compiling it all together. 

226 coord_string = "[{x_str}, {y_str}] = {z_str}".format( 

227 x_str=x_coord_string, y_str=y_coord_string, z_str=z_coord_string 

228 ) 

229 return coord_string 

230 

231 # Assigning the coordinate formatter derived. 

232 self._opihi_coordinate_formatter = CoordinateFormatter(self) 

233 self.opihi_axes.format_coord = self._opihi_coordinate_formatter 

234 

235 # Setting the layout, it is likely better to have the toolbar below 

236 # rather than above to avoid conflicts with the reset buttons in the 

237 # event of a mis-click. 

238 self.ui.vertical_layout_image.addWidget(self.opihi_canvas) 

239 self.ui.vertical_layout_image.addWidget(self.opihi_nav_toolbar) 

240 # Remove the dummy spacers otherwise it is just extra unneeded space. 

241 self.ui.vertical_layout_image.removeWidget(self.ui.dummy_opihi_image) 

242 self.ui.vertical_layout_image.removeWidget(self.ui.dummy_opihi_navbar) 

243 self.ui.dummy_opihi_image.hide() 

244 self.ui.dummy_opihi_navbar.hide() 

245 self.ui.dummy_opihi_image.deleteLater() 

246 self.ui.dummy_opihi_navbar.deleteLater() 

247 del self.ui.dummy_opihi_image 

248 del self.ui.dummy_opihi_navbar 

249 return None 

250 

251 def __init_preprocess_solution(self): 

252 """Initialize the preprocessing solution. The preprocessing files 

253 should be specified in the configuration file. 

254 

255 Parameters 

256 ---------- 

257 None 

258 

259 Returns 

260 ------- 

261 None 

262 """ 

263 # Using the configuration file to extract where the preprocessing 

264 # filenames are to build the solution. 

265 try: 

266 preprocess = opihiexarata.OpihiPreprocessSolution( 

267 mask_c_fits_filename=library.config.PREPROCESS_MASK_C_FITS_FILENAME, 

268 mask_g_fits_filename=library.config.PREPROCESS_MASK_G_FITS_FILENAME, 

269 mask_r_fits_filename=library.config.PREPROCESS_MASK_R_FITS_FILENAME, 

270 mask_i_fits_filename=library.config.PREPROCESS_MASK_I_FITS_FILENAME, 

271 mask_z_fits_filename=library.config.PREPROCESS_MASK_Z_FITS_FILENAME, 

272 mask_1_fits_filename=library.config.PREPROCESS_MASK_1_FITS_FILENAME, 

273 mask_2_fits_filename=library.config.PREPROCESS_MASK_2_FITS_FILENAME, 

274 mask_3_fits_filename=library.config.PREPROCESS_MASK_3_FITS_FILENAME, 

275 flat_c_fits_filename=library.config.PREPROCESS_FLAT_C_FITS_FILENAME, 

276 flat_g_fits_filename=library.config.PREPROCESS_FLAT_G_FITS_FILENAME, 

277 flat_r_fits_filename=library.config.PREPROCESS_FLAT_R_FITS_FILENAME, 

278 flat_i_fits_filename=library.config.PREPROCESS_FLAT_I_FITS_FILENAME, 

279 flat_z_fits_filename=library.config.PREPROCESS_FLAT_Z_FITS_FILENAME, 

280 flat_1_fits_filename=library.config.PREPROCESS_FLAT_1_FITS_FILENAME, 

281 flat_2_fits_filename=library.config.PREPROCESS_FLAT_2_FITS_FILENAME, 

282 flat_3_fits_filename=library.config.PREPROCESS_FLAT_3_FITS_FILENAME, 

283 bias_fits_filename=library.config.PREPROCESS_BIAS_FITS_FILENAME, 

284 dark_current_fits_filename=library.config.PREPROCESS_DARK_CURRENT_FITS_FILENAME, 

285 linearity_fits_filename=library.config.PREPROCESS_LINEARITY_FITS_FILENAME, 

286 ) 

287 except Exception: 

288 # Something failed with making the preprocess solution, a 

289 # configuration file issue is likely the reason. 

290 # TODO 

291 preprocess = None 

292 finally: 

293 self.preprocess_solution = preprocess 

294 # All done. 

295 return None 

296 

297 def __connect_push_button_new_image_automatic(self): 

298 """The automatic method relying on earliest fits file available in 

299 the expected directory. This function is a connected function action to 

300 a button in the GUI. 

301 

302 Parameters 

303 ---------- 

304 None 

305 

306 Returns 

307 ------- 

308 None 

309 """ 

310 # Fetch a file from the directory where files are to be fetched. 

311 try: 

312 new_fits_filename = library.path.get_most_recent_filename_in_directory( 

313 self.automatic_fetch_directory, "fits" 

314 ) 

315 except Exception: 

316 # Something happened and a new fits file cannot be properly 

317 # derived. 

318 new_fits_filename = "" 

319 

320 # If the user did not provide a file to enter, there is nothing to be 

321 # changed. 

322 if os.path.isfile(new_fits_filename): 

323 # Assign the new fits filename. 

324 self.raw_fits_filename = os.path.abspath(new_fits_filename) 

325 else: 

326 # Exit! 

327 return None 

328 

329 # Process the file first so that what the user sees is closer to 

330 # what it really is. 

331 

332 # Load up the new file. 

333 self._load_fits_file(fits_filename=self.raw_fits_filename) 

334 # All done. 

335 return None 

336 

337 def __connect_push_button_new_image_manual(self): 

338 """The manual method relying on earliest fits file available in 

339 the expected directory. This function is a connected function action to 

340 a button in the GUI. 

341 

342 Parameters 

343 ---------- 

344 None 

345 

346 Returns 

347 ------- 

348 None 

349 """ 

350 # Ask the user for the filename via a dialog. 

351 new_fits_filename, __ = QtWidgets.QFileDialog.getOpenFileName( 

352 parent=self, 

353 caption="Open Opihi Image", 

354 dir="./", 

355 filter="FITS Files (*.fits)", 

356 ) 

357 # If the user did not provide a file to enter, there is nothing to be 

358 # changed. 

359 if os.path.isfile(new_fits_filename): 

360 # Assign the new fits filename. 

361 self.raw_fits_filename = os.path.abspath(new_fits_filename) 

362 else: 

363 # Exit! 

364 return None 

365 

366 # We update the automatic fetching directory with the path from this 

367 # manual file. It is usually the case that the user expects updates 

368 # from their same directory. 

369 new_fits_directory = library.path.get_directory(pathname=self.raw_fits_filename) 

370 self.automatic_fetch_directory = new_fits_directory 

371 

372 # Process the file first so that what the user sees is closer to 

373 # what it really is. 

374 

375 # Load up the new file. 

376 self._load_fits_file(fits_filename=self.raw_fits_filename) 

377 # All done. 

378 return None 

379 

380 def __connect_push_button_new_target(self) -> None: 

381 """The function serving to set the software to be on a new target. 

382 A name is prompted from the user. 

383 

384 Parameters 

385 ---------- 

386 None 

387 

388 Returns 

389 ------- 

390 None 

391 """ 

392 # Find what the new name of the target from the user. 

393 previous_set_name = ( 

394 self.asteroid_set_name if self.asteroid_set_name is not None else str() 

395 ) 

396 new_set_name = gui.name.ask_user_target_name_window(default=previous_set_name) 

397 self.asteroid_set_name = new_set_name 

398 

399 # Reset the previous text as it is all going to be a new target. 

400 # It is expected after this a new image would be selected. 

401 self.clear_dynamic_label_text() 

402 

403 return None 

404 

405 def __connect_push_button_refresh_window(self) -> None: 

406 """The function serving to refresh the window and redrawing the plot. 

407 

408 Parameters 

409 ---------- 

410 None 

411 

412 Returns 

413 ------- 

414 None 

415 """ 

416 # Just redraw the plot and redo the dynamic text. 

417 self.redraw_opihi_image() 

418 self.refresh_dynamic_label_text() 

419 return None

421 def __connect_push_button_astrometry_solve_astrometry(self) -> None: 

422 """The button to instruct on the solving of the astrometric solution. 

423 

424 Parameters 

425 ---------- 

426 None 

427 

428 Returns 

429 ------- 

430 None 

431 """ 

432 # If there is no image (and thus no solution class), there is nothing 

433 # to do. 

434 if not isinstance(self.opihi_solution, opihiexarata.OpihiSolution): 

435 return None 

436 

437 # Determine the engine from user input via the drop down menu. The 

438 # recognizing text ought to be case insensitive, makes life easier. 

439 input_engine_name = self.ui.combo_box_astrometry_solve_engine.currentText() 

440 input_engine_name = input_engine_name.casefold() 

441 # Search programed engines for the one specified. 

442 if input_engine_name == "astrometry.net nova": 

443 engine = astrometry.AstrometryNetWebAPIEngine 

444 vehicle_args = {} 

445 else: 

446 raise error.DevelopmentError( 

447 "The provided input engine name `{in_eng}` is not implemented and" 

448 " cannot be matched to an implemented astrometric engine.".format( 

449 in_eng=str(input_engine_name) 

450 ) 

451 ) 

452 

453 # Solve the field using the provided engine. 

454 __ = self.opihi_solution.solve_astrometry( 

455 solver_engine=engine, overwrite=True, vehicle_args=vehicle_args 

456 ) 

457 # Update all of the necessary information. 

458 self.redraw_opihi_image() 

459 self.refresh_dynamic_label_text() 

460 return None 

461 

462 def __connect_push_button_astrometry_custom_solve(self) -> None: 

463 """ "The button which uses an astrometric solution to solve for a 

464 custom pixel location or RA DEC location depending on entry. 

465 

466 This prioritizes solving RA DEC from pixel location. 

467 

468 Parameters 

469 ---------- 

470 None 

471 

472 Returns 

473 ------- 

474 None 

475 """ 

476 # If there is no astrometric solution, nothing can be done. Exit this 

477 # early. 

478 if not ( 

479 isinstance(self.opihi_solution, opihiexarata.OpihiSolution) 

480 and isinstance( 

481 self.opihi_solution.astrometrics, astrometry.AstrometricSolution 

482 ) 

483 ): 

484 return None 

485 

486 # Obtain the current values in the entry field. 

487 in_custom_x = self.ui.line_edit_astrometry_custom_x.text() 

488 in_custom_y = self.ui.line_edit_astrometry_custom_y.text() 

489 in_custom_ra = self.ui.line_edit_astrometry_custom_ra.text() 

490 in_custom_dec = self.ui.line_edit_astrometry_custom_dec.text() 

491 

492 # Prioritize the presence of the pixel location text. 

493 if len(in_custom_x) != 0 and len(in_custom_y) != 0: 

494 # Using pixel locations to determine RA DEC. 

495 in_custom_x = float(in_custom_x) 

496 in_custom_y = float(in_custom_y) 

497 # Reformatting the entry. 

498 out_custom_x = str(in_custom_x) 

499 out_custom_y = str(in_custom_y) 

500 # Converting. 

501 ( 

502 out_custom_ra, 

503 out_custom_dec, 

504 ) = self.opihi_solution.astrometrics.pixel_to_sky_coordinates( 

505 x=in_custom_x, y=in_custom_y 

506 ) 

507 ( 

508 out_custom_ra, 

509 out_custom_dec, 

510 ) = library.conversion.degrees_to_sexagesimal_ra_dec( 

511 ra_deg=out_custom_ra, dec_deg=out_custom_dec, precision=2 

512 ) 

513 elif len(in_custom_ra) != 0 and len(in_custom_dec) != 0: 

514 # Using RA DEC to solve for pixel locations. 

515 # Reformatting the entry. 

516 out_custom_ra = str(in_custom_ra) 

517 out_custom_dec = str(in_custom_dec) 

518 

519 ( 

520 in_custom_ra_deg, 

521 in_custom_dec_deg, 

522 ) = library.conversion.sexagesimal_ra_dec_to_degrees( 

523 ra_sex=in_custom_ra, dec_sex=in_custom_dec 

524 ) 

525 ( 

526 out_custom_x, 

527 out_custom_y, 

528 ) = self.opihi_solution.astrometrics.sky_to_pixel_coordinates( 

529 ra=in_custom_ra_deg, dec=in_custom_dec_deg 

530 ) 

531 # Needs to be a string. 

532 out_custom_x = str(out_custom_x) 

533 out_custom_y = str(out_custom_y) 

534 else: 

535 # No matching pair has been provided, ignore. 

536 out_custom_x = str(in_custom_x) 

537 out_custom_y = str(in_custom_y) 

538 out_custom_ra = str(in_custom_ra) 

539 out_custom_dec = str(in_custom_dec) 

540 

541 # Finally, set the text on the values. 

542 self.ui.line_edit_astrometry_custom_x.setText(out_custom_x) 

543 self.ui.line_edit_astrometry_custom_y.setText(out_custom_y) 

544 self.ui.line_edit_astrometry_custom_ra.setText(out_custom_ra) 

545 self.ui.line_edit_astrometry_custom_dec.setText(out_custom_dec) 

546 return None 

547 

548 def __connect_push_button_photometry_solve_photometry(self) -> None: 

549 """A routine to use the current observation and historical observations 

550 to derive the propagation solution. 

551 

552 Parameters 

553 ---------- 

554 None 

555 

556 Returns 

557 ------- 

558 None 

559 """ 

560 # If there is no image (and thus no solution class), there is nothing 

561 # to do. 

562 if not isinstance(self.opihi_solution, opihiexarata.OpihiSolution): 

563 return None 

564 

565 # Determine the engine from user input via the drop down menu. The 

566 # recognizing text ought to be case insensitive, makes life easier. 

567 input_engine_name = self.ui.combo_box_photometry_solve_engine.currentText() 

568 input_engine_name = input_engine_name.casefold() 

569 # Search programed engines for the one specified. 

570 if input_engine_name == "pan-starrs 3pi dr2 mast": 

571 engine = photometry.PanstarrsMastWebAPIEngine 

572 vehicle_args = {} 

573 else: 

574 raise error.DevelopmentError( 

575 "The provided input engine name `{in_eng}` is not implemented and" 

576 " cannot be matched to an implemented photometric engine.".format( 

577 in_eng=str(input_engine_name) 

578 ) 

579 ) 

580 # Solve. 

581 __ = self.opihi_solution.solve_photometry( 

582 solver_engine=engine, overwrite=True, vehicle_args=vehicle_args 

583 ) 

584 

585 # Update all of the necessary information. 

586 self.redraw_opihi_image() 

587 self.refresh_dynamic_label_text() 

588 return None 

589 

590 def __connect_push_button_orbit_solve_orbit(self) -> None: 

591 """A routine to use the current observation and historical observations 

592 to derive the orbit solution. 

593 

594 Parameters 

595 ---------- 

596 None 

597 

598 Returns 

599 ------- 

600 None 

601 """ 

602 # If there is no image (and thus no solution class), there is nothing 

603 # to do. 

604 if not isinstance(self.opihi_solution, opihiexarata.OpihiSolution): 

605 return None 

606 

607 # Determine the engine from user input via the drop down menu. The 

608 # recognizing text ought to be case insensitive, makes life easier. 

609 input_engine_name = self.ui.combo_box_orbit_solve_engine.currentText() 

610 input_engine_name = input_engine_name.casefold() 

611 # Search programed engines for the one specified. 

612 if input_engine_name == "orbfit": 

613 engine = orbit.OrbfitOrbitDeterminerEngine 

614 vehicle_args = {} 

615 elif input_engine_name == "custom": 

616 engine = orbit.CustomOrbitEngine 

617 # The custom orbit requires than an orbit be specified, we 

618 # commandeer the orbital element reporting window. 

619 custom_orbit_elements = self._parse_custom_orbital_elements() 

620 vehicle_args = custom_orbit_elements 

621 else: 

622 raise error.DevelopmentError( 

623 "The provided input engine name `{in_eng}` is not implemented and" 

624 " cannot be matched to an implemented orbital engine.".format( 

625 in_eng=str(input_engine_name) 

626 ) 

627 ) 

628 # Solve. 

629 __ = self.opihi_solution.solve_orbit( 

630 solver_engine=engine, overwrite=True, vehicle_args=vehicle_args 

631 ) 

632 

633 # Update all of the necessary information. 

634 self.redraw_opihi_image() 

635 self.refresh_dynamic_label_text() 

636 # All done. 

637 return None 

638 

639 def __connect_push_button_orbit_solve_ephemeris(self) -> None: 

640 """A routine to use the current observation and historical observations 

641 to derive the orbit solution. 

642 

643 Parameters 

644 ---------- 

645 None 

646 

647 Returns 

648 ------- 

649 None 

650 """ 

651 # If there is no image (and thus no solution class), there is nothing 

652 # to do. 

653 if not isinstance(self.opihi_solution, opihiexarata.OpihiSolution): 

654 return None 

655 

656 # Determine the engine from user input via the drop down menu. The 

657 # recognizing text ought to be case insensitive, makes life easier. 

658 input_engine_name = self.ui.combo_box_ephemeris_solve_engine.currentText() 

659 input_engine_name = input_engine_name.casefold() 

660 # Search programed engines for the one specified. 

661 if input_engine_name == "jpl horizons": 

662 engine = ephemeris.JPLHorizonsWebAPIEngine 

663 vehicle_args = {} 

664 else: 

665 raise error.DevelopmentError( 

666 "The provided input engine name `{in_eng}` is not implemented and" 

667 " cannot be matched to an implemented ephemeritic engine.".format( 

668 in_eng=str(input_engine_name) 

669 ) 

670 ) 

671 # Solve. 

672 __ = self.opihi_solution.solve_ephemeris( 

673 solver_engine=engine, overwrite=True, vehicle_args=vehicle_args 

674 ) 

675 

676 # Update all of the necessary information. 

677 self.redraw_opihi_image() 

678 self.refresh_dynamic_label_text() 

679 # All done. 

680 return None 

681 

682 def __connect_push_button_propagate_custom_solve(self) -> None: 

683 """Solving for the location of the target through the ephemeris based 

684 on the time and date provided by the user. 

685 

686 Parameters 

687 ---------- 

688 None 

689 

690 Returns 

691 ------- 

692 None 

693 """ 

694 # If there is no propagation solution, there is nothing to be done. 

695 if not isinstance( 

696 self.opihi_solution.ephemeritics, ephemeris.EphemeriticSolution 

697 ): 

698 return None 

699 

700 # Get the time and date from the user input. 

701 datetime_input = self.ui.date_time_edit_ephemeris_date_time.dateTime() 

702 # Getting the timezone, as the propagation requires UTC/JD time, a 

703 # conversion is needed. Qt uses IANA timezone IDs so we convert from 

704 # the human readable ones to it. We only deal with current timezones. 

705 timezone_input = self.ui.combo_box_ephemeris_timezone.currentText() 

706 timezone_input = timezone_input.casefold() 

707 if timezone_input == "utc+00:00": 

708 qt_timezone_str = "Etc/UTC" 

709 elif timezone_input == "hst-10:00": 

710 qt_timezone_str = "Pacific/Honolulu" 

711 else: 

712 error.DevelopmentError( 

713 "The timezone dropdown entry provided by the GUI is not implemented and" 

714 " has no translation to an IANA timezone ID." 

715 ) 

716 

717 # Using Qt's own datetime conversion just because it is already here. 

718 qt_timezone_bytearray = QtCore.QByteArray(qt_timezone_str.encode()) 

719 qt_timezone = QtCore.QTimeZone(qt_timezone_bytearray) 

720 datetime_input.setTimeZone(qt_timezone) 

721 unix_time_input = datetime_input.toSecsSinceEpoch() 

722 # As a Julian day as that is the standard time system. 

723 julian_day_input = library.conversion.unix_time_to_julian_day( 

724 unix_time=unix_time_input 

725 ) 

726 

727 # Using this unique time provided to solve the propagation. 

728 ra_deg, dec_deg = self.opihi_solution.ephemeritics.forward_ephemeris( 

729 future_time=julian_day_input 

730 ) 

731 ra_sex, dec_sex = library.conversion.degrees_to_sexagesimal_ra_dec( 

732 ra_deg=ra_deg, dec_deg=dec_deg, precision=2 

733 ) 

734 # Updating the RA and DEC values. 

735 self.ui.label_dynamic_ephemeris_custom_ra.setText(ra_sex) 

736 self.ui.label_dynamic_ephemeris_custom_dec.setText(dec_sex) 

737 

738 # All done. 

739 return None 

740 

741 def __connect_push_button_propagate_solve_propagation(self) -> None: 

742 """A routine to use the current observation and historical observations 

743 to derive the propagation solution. 

744 

745 Parameters 

746 ---------- 

747 None 

748 

749 Returns 

750 ------- 

751 None 

752 """ 

753 # If there is no image (and thus no solution class), there is nothing 

754 # to do. 

755 if not isinstance(self.opihi_solution, opihiexarata.OpihiSolution): 

756 return None 

757 

758 # Determine the engine from user input via the drop down menu. The 

759 # recognizing text ought to be case insensitive, makes life easier. 

760 input_engine_name = self.ui.combo_box_propagate_solve_engine.currentText() 

761 input_engine_name = input_engine_name.casefold() 

762 # Search programed engines for the one specified. 

763 if input_engine_name == "linear": 

764 engine = propagate.LinearPropagationEngine 

765 vehicle_args = {} 

766 elif input_engine_name == "quadratic": 

767 engine = propagate.QuadraticPropagationEngine 

768 vehicle_args = {} 

769 else: 

770 raise error.DevelopmentError( 

771 "The provided input engine name `{in_eng}` is not implemented and" 

772 " cannot be matched to an implemented propagative engine.".format( 

773 in_eng=str(input_engine_name) 

774 ) 

775 ) 

776 # Solve. 

777 __ = self.opihi_solution.solve_propagate( 

778 solver_engine=engine, overwrite=True, vehicle_args=vehicle_args 

779 ) 

780 

781 # Update all of the necessary information. 

782 self.redraw_opihi_image() 

783 self.refresh_dynamic_label_text() 

784 return None 

785 

786 def __connect_push_button_propagate_custom_solve(self) -> None: 

787 """Solving for the location of the target through propagation based on 

788 the time and date provided by the user. 

789 

790 Parameters 

791 ---------- 

792 None 

793 

794 Returns 

795 ------- 

796 None 

797 """ 

798 # If there is no propagation solution, there is nothing to be done. 

799 if not isinstance( 

800 self.opihi_solution.propagatives, propagate.PropagativeSolution 

801 ): 

802 return None 

803 

804 # Get the time and date from the user input. 

805 datetime_input = self.ui.date_time_edit_propagate_date_time.dateTime() 

806 # Getting the timezone, as the propagation requires UTC/JD time, a 

807 # conversion is needed. Qt uses IANA timezone IDs so we convert from 

808 # the human readable ones to it. We only deal with current timezones. 

809 timezone_input = self.ui.combo_box_propagate_timezone.currentText() 

810 timezone_input = timezone_input.casefold() 

811 if timezone_input == "utc+00:00": 

812 qt_timezone_str = "Etc/UTC" 

813 elif timezone_input == "hst-10:00": 

814 qt_timezone_str = "Pacific/Honolulu" 

815 else: 

816 error.DevelopmentError( 

817 "The timezone dropdown entry provided by the GUI is not implemented and" 

818 " has no translation to an IANA timezone ID." 

819 ) 

820 

821 # Using Qt's own datetime conversion just because it is already here. 

822 qt_timezone_bytearray = QtCore.QByteArray(qt_timezone_str.encode()) 

823 qt_timezone = QtCore.QTimeZone(qt_timezone_bytearray) 

824 datetime_input.setTimeZone(qt_timezone) 

825 unix_time_input = datetime_input.toSecsSinceEpoch() 

826 # As a Julian day as that is the standard time system. 

827 julian_day_input = library.conversion.unix_time_to_julian_day( 

828 unix_time=unix_time_input 

829 ) 

830 

831 # Using this unique time provided to solve the propagation. 

832 ra_deg, dec_deg = self.opihi_solution.propagatives.forward_propagate( 

833 future_time=julian_day_input 

834 ) 

835 ra_sex, dec_sex = library.conversion.degrees_to_sexagesimal_ra_dec( 

836 ra_deg=ra_deg, dec_deg=dec_deg, precision=2 

837 ) 

838 # Updating the RA and DEC values. 

839 self.ui.label_dynamic_propagate_custom_ra.setText(ra_sex) 

840 self.ui.label_dynamic_propagate_custom_dec.setText(dec_sex) 

841 

842 # All done. 

843 return None 

844 

845 def __get_mpc_record_filename(self) -> str: 

846 """This is a function which derives the MPC record filename from 

847 naming conventions and the current fits file name. 

848 

849 Parameters 

850 ---------- 

851 None 

852 

853 Returns 

854 ------- 

855 mpc_record_filename : str 

856 The filename of the MPC record for this object/image. 

857 """ 

858 mpc_target_name = self.asteroid_set_name 

859 mpc_record_filename = "{an}__exarata_mpcrecord".format(an=mpc_target_name) 

860 # Search the same directory as the fits file for this information as 

861 # that is currently the expected location. 

862 # Preferring the preprocessed filename if it exists, have a fall back. 

863 fits_pathname = ( 

864 self.raw_fits_filename 

865 if self.process_fits_filename is None 

866 else self.process_fits_filename 

867 ) 

868 fits_directory = library.path.get_directory(pathname=fits_pathname) 

869 mpc_record_filename = library.path.merge_pathname( 

870 directory=fits_directory, filename=mpc_record_filename, extension="txt" 

871 ) 

872 return mpc_record_filename 

873 

874 def _preprocess_fits_file( 

875 self, raw_filename: str, process_filename: str = None 

876 ) -> str: 

877 """Using the provided filename, preprocess the fits file listed. 

878 

879 This is used primarily during the loading of a new fits file. 

880 

881 Parameters 

882 ---------- 

883 raw_filename : string 

884 The filename of the raw fits file to be preprocessed. 

885 process_filename : string, default = None 

886 The filename where the processed fits file will be saved to. If 

887 None, it defaults to a sensible naming convention to distinguish 

888 the two. 

889 

890 Returns 

891 ------- 

892 process_filename : string 

893 The filename of the preprocessed file is returned, this is just 

894 in case the value was derived from the naming convention. This is 

895 an absolute path. 

896 """ 

897 # Deriving saving location of the processed fits file. 

898 if isinstance(process_filename, str): 

899 process_filename = os.path.abspath(process_filename) 

900 else: 

901 # Use a sensible naming convention to distinguish between the raw 

902 # and processed file. 

903 # TODO 

904 process_filename = "./process.fits" 

905 

906 # Saving for later. 

907 self.process_fits_filename = process_filename 

908 

909 # Process the fits file. 

910 __ = self.preprocess_solution.preprocess_fits_file( 

911 raw_filename=raw_filename, out_filename=process_filename 

912 ) 

913 # All done. 

914 return process_filename 

915 

916 def _load_fits_file(self, fits_filename: str) -> None: 

917 """Load a fits file into the GUI to derive all of the solutions needed. 

918 

919 This loads the fits file into an OpihiSolution class for which this 

920 GUI interacts with and derives the information from. 

921 

922 Parameters 

923 ---------- 

924 fits_filename : str 

925 The fits filename which will be loaded. 

926 

927 Returns 

928 ------- 

929 None 

930 """ 

931 # Saving the previous file and other information. 

932 self.save_results() 

933 

934 # Extracting the header of this fits file to get the observing 

935 # metadata from it. 

936 header, __ = library.fits.read_fits_image_file(filename=fits_filename) 

937 

938 # The filter which image is in, extracted from the fits file, 

939 # assuming standard form. 

940 filter_name = "g" 

941 

942 # The exposure time of the image, extracted from the fits file, 

943 # assuming standard form. 

944 exposure_time = float(header["ITIME"]) 

945 

946 # Converting date to Julian day as the solution class requires it. 

947 # We use the modified Julian day from the header file. 

948 observing_time = library.conversion.modified_julian_day_to_julian_day( 

949 mjd=header["MJD_OBS"] 

950 ) 

951 

952 # For asteroid information, if we are to prompt the user for 

953 # information about the asteroid. 

954 if library.config.GUI_MANUAL_PROMPT_FOR_ASTEROID_INFORMATION: 

955 # The name is derived from the current object set that we are on. 

956 asteroid_name = self.asteroid_set_name 

957 # Use the target selector GUI for the position of the asteroid. 

958 asteroid_location = gui.selector.ask_user_target_selector_window( 

959 current_fits_filename=fits_filename 

960 ) 

961 # If there exists a MPC record of previous observations, use it 

962 # for the history. If it does not exist, make one. 

963 mpcrecord_filename = self.__get_mpc_record_filename() 

964 if not os.path.isfile(mpcrecord_filename): 

965 with open(mpcrecord_filename, "w"): 

966 pass 

967 # Read the historical data. 

968 with open(mpcrecord_filename, "r") as mpcfile: 

969 raw_lines = mpcfile.readlines() 

970 # The files have new line characters on them, they need to be 

971 # removed to have the normal 80 characters. 

972 asteroid_history = [linedex.removesuffix("\n") for linedex in raw_lines] 

973 else: 

974 asteroid_name = None 

975 asteroid_location = None 

976 asteroid_history = None 

977 

978 # Although the OpihiSolution could derive these values from the 

979 # header of the filename, the solution class is built to be general. 

980 # Creating the solution from the data. 

981 opihi_solution = opihiexarata.OpihiSolution( 

982 fits_filename=fits_filename, 

983 filter_name=filter_name, 

984 exposure_time=exposure_time, 

985 observing_time=observing_time, 

986 asteroid_name=asteroid_name, 

987 asteroid_location=asteroid_location, 

988 asteroid_history=asteroid_history, 

989 ) 

990 self.opihi_solution = opihi_solution 

991 

992 # Because a new image was loaded, the previous values and other 

993 # information derived from the last image are invalid, reset and replot. 

994 self.clear_dynamic_label_text() 

995 self.refresh_dynamic_label_text() 

996 self.redraw_opihi_image() 

997 return None 

998 

999 def _parse_custom_orbital_elements(self) -> dict: 

1000 """This function takes the textual form of the orbital elements as 

1001 entered and tries to parse it into a set of orbital elements and errors. 

1002 

1003 Parameters 

1004 ---------- 

1005 None 

1006 

1007 Returns 

1008 ------- 

1009 orbital_elements : dictionary 

1010 A dictionary of the orbital elements and their errors, if they 

1011 exist. 

1012 """ 

1013 # Extracting all of the values from the text. 

1014 sm_axis_str = self.ui.line_edit_orbit_semimajor_axis.text().strip() 

1015 ecc_str = self.ui.line_edit_orbit_eccentricity.text().strip() 

1016 incli_str = self.ui.line_edit_orbit_inclination.text().strip() 

1017 as_node_str = self.ui.line_edit_orbit_ascending_node.text().strip() 

1018 peri_str = self.ui.line_edit_orbit_perihelion.text().strip() 

1019 m_anom_str = self.ui.line_edit_orbit_mean_anomaly.text().strip() 

1020 epoch_str = self.ui.line_edit_orbit_epoch.text().strip() 

1021 

1022 # Parse if there is an error bar or not. Writing a function because 

1023 # this is going to be happening a lot. 

1024 def error_bar_parse(entry_string: str) -> tuple[float, float]: 

1025 """The deliminator for an error bar is any non numeric or decimal 

1026 marker.""" 

1027 entry_string = entry_string.strip() 

1028 non_demlim_marks = tuple("1234567890.,") 

1029 # In the event there are more than one character acting as 

1030 # a deliminator. 

1031 lower_delim_index = None 

1032 upper_delim_index = None 

1033 for index, chardex in enumerate(entry_string): 

1034 if chardex not in non_demlim_marks: 

1035 # This character is a deliminator, mark it. 

1036 if lower_delim_index is None: 

1037 # This is the first time a deliminator character has 

1038 # been encountered. 

1039 lower_delim_index = index 

1040 else: 

1041 # Other deliminator characters have been encountered so 

1042 # this is the last known deliminator. 

1043 upper_delim_index = index 

1044 # Split the string based on the deliminator for the value and 

1045 # error segment. 

1046 if lower_delim_index is None and upper_delim_index is None: 

1047 # There was never a deliminator, there is only one value and 

1048 # no error bars. 

1049 value_number = float(entry_string) 

1050 error_number = 0 

1051 elif lower_delim_index is not None and upper_delim_index is None: 

1052 # There is only one deliminator character, use this to split 

1053 # the string. 

1054 value_string = entry_string[:lower_delim_index].strip() 

1055 error_string = entry_string[lower_delim_index:].strip() 

1056 # Converting to values. 

1057 value_number = float(value_string) 

1058 error_number = float(error_string) 

1059 elif lower_delim_index is not None and upper_delim_index is not None: 

1060 # There are more than one characters for the deliminator. 

1061 value_string = entry_string[:lower_delim_index].strip() 

1062 error_string = entry_string[upper_delim_index:].strip() 

1063 # Converting to values. 

1064 value_number = float(value_string) 

1065 error_number = float(error_string) 

1066 # All done. 

1067 return value_number, error_number 

1068 

1069 # Parsing the strings. 

1070 sm_axis_val, sm_axis_err = error_bar_parse(sm_axis_str) 

1071 ecc_val, ecc_err = error_bar_parse(ecc_str) 

1072 incli_val, incli_err = error_bar_parse(incli_str) 

1073 as_node_val, as_node_err = error_bar_parse(as_node_str) 

1074 peri_val, peri_err = error_bar_parse(peri_str) 

1075 m_anom_val, m_anom_err = error_bar_parse(m_anom_str) 

1076 epoch_val, epoch_err = error_bar_parse(epoch_str) 

1077 # The Epoch should not have an error. 

1078 if epoch_err != 0: 

1079 raise error.InputError( 

1080 "The Epoch value is detecting that it is specified with an error term" 

1081 " with a non-numeric deliminator. However, the Epoch should not have an" 

1082 " error specified." 

1083 ) 

1084 # The orbital element dictionary which would be used for a custom 

1085 # orbit. 

1086 orbital_elements = { 

1087 "semimajor_axis": sm_axis_val, 

1088 "semimajor_axis_error": sm_axis_err, 

1089 "eccentricity": ecc_val, 

1090 "eccentricity_error": ecc_err, 

1091 "inclination": incli_val, 

1092 "inclination_error": incli_err, 

1093 "longitude_ascending_node": as_node_val, 

1094 "longitude_ascending_node_error": as_node_err, 

1095 "argument_perihelion": peri_val, 

1096 "argument_perihelion_error": peri_err, 

1097 "mean_anomaly": m_anom_val, 

1098 "mean_anomaly_error": m_anom_err, 

1099 "epoch_julian_day": epoch_val, 

1100 } 

1101 # All done. 

1102 return orbital_elements 

1103 

1104 def clear_dynamic_label_text(self) -> None: 

1105 """Clear all of the dynamic label text and other related fields, 

1106 this is traditionally done just before a new image is going to be 

1107 introduced. 

1108 

1109 This resets the text back to their defaults as per the GUI builder. 

1110 

1111 The selections on the engines do not need to be reset as they are 

1112 just a selection criteria and do not actually provide any information. 

1113 

1114 Parameters 

1115 ---------- 

1116 None 

1117 

1118 Returns 

1119 ------- 

1120 None 

1121 """ 

1122 ## Resetting Summary information. 

1123 ##### 

1124 

1125 ## Resetting Astrometry information. 

1126 ##### 

1127 self.ui.label_dynamic_astrometry_center_x.setText("0000") 

1128 self.ui.label_dynamic_astrometry_center_y.setText("0000") 

1129 self.ui.label_dynamic_astrometry_center_ra.setText("HH:MM:SS.SS") 

1130 self.ui.label_dynamic_astrometry_center_dec.setText("+DD:MM:SS.SS") 

1131 self.ui.label_dynamic_astrometry_target_x.setText("0000") 

1132 self.ui.label_dynamic_astrometry_target_y.setText("0000") 

1133 self.ui.label_dynamic_astrometry_target_ra.setText("HH:MM:SS.SS") 

1134 self.ui.label_dynamic_astrometry_target_dec.setText("+DD:MM:SS.SS") 

1135 self.ui.line_edit_astrometry_custom_x.setText("") 

1136 self.ui.line_edit_astrometry_custom_y.setText("") 

1137 self.ui.line_edit_astrometry_custom_ra.setText("") 

1138 self.ui.line_edit_astrometry_custom_dec.setText("") 

1139 

1140 ## Resetting Photometric information. 

1141 ##### 

1142 self.ui.label_dynamic_photometry_filter_name.setText("FF") 

1143 self.ui.label_dynamic_photometry_zero_point_value.setText("ZZ.ZZ + E.EEE") 

1144 

1145 ## Resetting Orbit information. 

1146 ##### 

1147 

1148 ## Resetting Ephemeris information. 

1149 ##### 

1150 self.ui.label_dynamic_ephemeris_ra_velocity.setText("+VV.VVV") 

1151 self.ui.label_dynamic_ephemeris_dec_velocity.setText("+VV.VVV") 

1152 self.ui.label_dynamic_ephemeris_ra_acceleration.setText("+AA.AAAeXX") 

1153 self.ui.label_dynamic_ephemeris_dec_acceleration.setText("+AA.AAAeXX") 

1154 

1155 ## Resetting Propagate information. 

1156 ##### 

1157 self.ui.label_dynamic_propagate_ra_velocity.setText("+VV.VVV") 

1158 self.ui.label_dynamic_propagate_dec_velocity.setText("+VV.VVV") 

1159 self.ui.label_dynamic_propagate_ra_acceleration.setText("+AA.AAAeXX") 

1160 self.ui.label_dynamic_propagate_dec_acceleration.setText("+AA.AAAeXX") 

1161 self.ui.text_browser_propagate_future_results.setPlainText( 

1162 "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS Z | HH:MM:SS.SS +DD:MM:SS.SS" 

1163 ) 

1164 # Keeping the timezone and time information for convenience. 

1165 self.ui.label_dynamic_propagate_custom_ra.setText("HH:MM:SS.SS") 

1166 self.ui.label_dynamic_propagate_custom_dec.setText("+DD:MM:SS.SS") 

1167 

1168 # All done. 

1169 return None 

1170 

1171 def refresh_dynamic_label_text(self) -> None: 

1172 """Refresh all of the dynamic label text, this fills out the 

1173 information based on the current solutions available and solved. 

1174 

1175 Parameters 

1176 ---------- 

1177 None 

1178 

1179 Returns 

1180 ------- 

1181 None 

1182 """ 

1183 

1184 # These values are only to be done if the OpihiSolution actually 

1185 # exists, otherwise, there is nothing to update in the text. 

1186 if isinstance(self.opihi_solution, opihiexarata.OpihiSolution): 

1187 self.__refresh_dynamic_label_text_astrometry() 

1188 self.__refresh_dynamic_label_text_photometry() 

1189 self.__refresh_dynamic_label_text_orbit() 

1190 self.__refresh_dynamic_label_text_ephemeris() 

1191 self.__refresh_dynamic_label_text_propagate() 

1192 

1193 # All done. 

1194 return None 

1195 

1196 def __refresh_dynamic_label_text_astrometry(self) -> None: 

1197 """Refresh all of the dynamic label text for astrometry. 

1198 This fills out the information based on the current solutions 

1199 available and solved. 

1200 

1201 An astrometric solution must exist. 

1202 

1203 Parameters 

1204 ---------- 

1205 None 

1206 

1207 Returns 

1208 ------- 

1209 None 

1210 """ 

1211 # Everything in this function needs the OpihiSolution, if it does not 

1212 # exist, then exit early as there is nothing to refresh. 

1213 if not isinstance(self.opihi_solution, opihiexarata.OpihiSolution): 

1214 return None 

1215 else: 

1216 opihi_solution = self.opihi_solution 

1217 

1218 # The pixel center location of the image and the pixel location of 

1219 # the asteroid does not require the astrometric solution. 

1220 cen_x, cen_y = [side / 2 for side in opihi_solution.data.shape] 

1221 trg_x, trg_y = ( 

1222 opihi_solution.asteroid_location 

1223 if opihi_solution.asteroid_location is not None 

1224 else (0, 0) 

1225 ) 

1226 # Replace the text with the new information. 

1227 self.ui.label_dynamic_astrometry_center_x.setText(str(cen_x)) 

1228 self.ui.label_dynamic_astrometry_center_y.setText(str(cen_y)) 

1229 self.ui.label_dynamic_astrometry_target_x.setText(str(trg_x)) 

1230 self.ui.label_dynamic_astrometry_target_y.setText(str(trg_y)) 

1231 

1232 # Everything beyond this point requires an astrometric solution, if 

1233 # it does not exist, there is no point in continuing, exiting early. 

1234 if not isinstance( 

1235 self.opihi_solution.astrometrics, astrometry.AstrometricSolution 

1236 ): 

1237 return None 

1238 else: 

1239 astrometrics = self.opihi_solution.astrometrics 

1240 

1241 # The pixel locations converted to RA DEC via the astrometric solution. 

1242 cen_ra, cen_dec = astrometrics.pixel_to_sky_coordinates(x=cen_x, y=cen_y) 

1243 trg_ra, trg_dec = astrometrics.pixel_to_sky_coordinates(x=trg_x, y=trg_y) 

1244 

1245 # The format really ought to be in HMSDMS hexadecimal-like as it 

1246 # is more familiar to Astronomers. 

1247 cen_ra_sex, cen_dec_sex = library.conversion.degrees_to_sexagesimal_ra_dec( 

1248 ra_deg=cen_ra, dec_deg=cen_dec, precision=2 

1249 ) 

1250 trg_ra_sex, trg_dec_sex = library.conversion.degrees_to_sexagesimal_ra_dec( 

1251 ra_deg=trg_ra, dec_deg=trg_dec, precision=2 

1252 ) 

1253 # Replace the text. 

1254 self.ui.label_dynamic_astrometry_center_ra.setText(cen_ra_sex) 

1255 self.ui.label_dynamic_astrometry_center_dec.setText(cen_dec_sex) 

1256 self.ui.label_dynamic_astrometry_target_ra.setText(trg_ra_sex) 

1257 self.ui.label_dynamic_astrometry_target_dec.setText(trg_dec_sex) 

1258 

1259 # All done. 

1260 return None 

1261 

1262 def __refresh_dynamic_label_text_photometry(self) -> None: 

1263 """Refresh all of the dynamic label text for photometry. 

1264 This fills out the information based on the current solutions 

1265 available and solved. 

1266 

1267 A photometric solution must exist. 

1268 

1269 Parameters 

1270 ---------- 

1271 None 

1272 

1273 Returns 

1274 ------- 

1275 None 

1276 """ 

1277 

1278 # Everything in this function needs the OpihiSolution, if it does not 

1279 # exist, then exit early as there is nothing to refresh. 

1280 if not isinstance(self.opihi_solution, opihiexarata.OpihiSolution): 

1281 return None 

1282 else: 

1283 opihi_solution = self.opihi_solution 

1284 

1285 # The filter is provided by the image's header, a solution is not 

1286 # required for displaying this information. 

1287 filter_name = str(opihi_solution.filter_name) 

1288 self.ui.label_dynamic_photometry_filter_name.setText(filter_name) 

1289 

1290 # Everything beyond this point requires an astrometric solution, if 

1291 # it does not exist, there is no point in continuing, exiting early. 

1292 if not isinstance( 

1293 self.opihi_solution.photometrics, photometry.PhotometricSolution 

1294 ): 

1295 return None 

1296 else: 

1297 photometrics = self.opihi_solution.photometrics 

1298 

1299 # Obtaining the computed zero point of the image. Some rounding is 

1300 # needed so it can properly fit in the GUI. 

1301 zero_point = round(photometrics.zero_point, 2) 

1302 zero_point_error = round(photometrics.zero_point_error, 3) 

1303 # Building the string for display and updating the text. 

1304 pm_sym = "\u00B1" 

1305 zero_point_str = "{zp} {pm} {err}".format( 

1306 zp=zero_point, pm=pm_sym, err=zero_point_error 

1307 ) 

1308 self.ui.label_dynamic_photometry_zero_point_value.setText(zero_point_str) 

1309 

1310 # All done. 

1311 return None 

1312 

1313 def __refresh_dynamic_label_text_orbit(self) -> None: 

1314 """Refresh all of the dynamic label text for orbit. 

1315 This fills out the information based on the current solutions 

1316 available and solved. 

1317 

1318 An orbital solution must exist. 

1319 

1320 Parameters 

1321 ---------- 

1322 None 

1323 

1324 Returns 

1325 ------- 

1326 None 

1327 """ 

1328 # Everything in this function needs the OpihiSolution, if it does not 

1329 # exist, then exit early as there is nothing to refresh. 

1330 if not isinstance(self.opihi_solution, opihiexarata.OpihiSolution): 

1331 return None 

1332 else: 

1333 opihi_solution = self.opihi_solution 

1334 

1335 # Nothing so far. 

1336 pass 

1337 

1338 # Everything beyond this point requires an orbital solution, if 

1339 # it does not exist, there is no point in continuing, exiting early. 

1340 if not isinstance(self.opihi_solution.orbitals, orbit.OrbitalSolution): 

1341 return None 

1342 else: 

1343 orbitals = self.opihi_solution.orbitals 

1344 

1345 # Refreshing the values of the Keplerian orbital elements. 

1346 # The orbital elements' values and errors should be reported. We define 

1347 # the string formatting here. 

1348 def orb_str_conv(val: float, err: float) -> str: 

1349 """Unified string formatting for orbital element values and errors.""" 

1350 # Rounding values to sensible values. 

1351 val = round(val, 7) 

1352 err = round(err, 3) 

1353 # Building the string, allowing for the usage of the plus minus 

1354 # symbol to demark the error. 

1355 pm_sym = "\u00B1" 

1356 ele_string = "{v} {pm} {e}".format(v=val, pm=pm_sym, e=err) 

1357 return ele_string 

1358 

1359 # Using the above function to derive the display strings for all of the 

1360 # elements. 

1361 semimajor_axis_string = orb_str_conv( 

1362 val=orbitals.semimajor_axis, err=orbitals.semimajor_axis_error 

1363 ) 

1364 eccentricity_string = orb_str_conv( 

1365 val=orbitals.eccentricity, err=orbitals.eccentricity_error 

1366 ) 

1367 inclination_string = orb_str_conv( 

1368 val=orbitals.inclination, err=orbitals.inclination_error 

1369 ) 

1370 ascending_node_string = orb_str_conv( 

1371 val=orbitals.longitude_ascending_node, 

1372 err=orbitals.longitude_ascending_node_error, 

1373 ) 

1374 perihelion_string = orb_str_conv( 

1375 val=orbitals.argument_perihelion, err=orbitals.argument_perihelion_error 

1376 ) 

1377 mean_anomaly_string = orb_str_conv( 

1378 val=orbitals.mean_anomaly, err=orbitals.mean_anomaly_error 

1379 ) 

1380 # Changing the text using the derived strings. 

1381 self.ui.line_edit_orbit_semimajor_axis.setText(semimajor_axis_string) 

1382 self.ui.line_edit_orbit_eccentricity.setText(eccentricity_string) 

1383 self.ui.line_edit_orbit_inclination.setText(inclination_string) 

1384 self.ui.line_edit_orbit_ascending_node.setText(ascending_node_string) 

1385 self.ui.line_edit_orbit_perihelion.setText(perihelion_string) 

1386 self.ui.line_edit_orbit_mean_anomaly.setText(mean_anomaly_string) 

1387 

1388 # Maximum precision on the epoch Julian day is desired however. 

1389 julian_day_string = str(orbitals.epoch_julian_day) 

1390 self.ui.line_edit_orbit_epoch.setText(julian_day_string) 

1391 

1392 # All done. 

1393 return None 

1394 

1395 def __refresh_dynamic_label_text_ephemeris(self) -> None: 

1396 """Refresh all of the dynamic label text for ephemerides. 

1397 This fills out the information based on the current solutions 

1398 available and solved. 

1399 

1400 An ephemeritic solution must exist. 

1401 

1402 Parameters 

1403 ---------- 

1404 None 

1405 

1406 Returns 

1407 ------- 

1408 None 

1409 """ 

1410 # Everything in this function needs the OpihiSolution, if it does not 

1411 # exist, then exit early as there is nothing to refresh. 

1412 if not isinstance(self.opihi_solution, opihiexarata.OpihiSolution): 

1413 return None 

1414 else: 

1415 opihi_solution = self.opihi_solution 

1416 

1417 # Nothing so far. 

1418 pass 

1419 

1420 # Everything beyond this point requires an orbital solution, if 

1421 # it does not exist, there is no point in continuing, exiting early. 

1422 if not isinstance( 

1423 self.opihi_solution.ephemeritics, ephemeris.EphemeriticSolution 

1424 ): 

1425 return None 

1426 else: 

1427 ephemeritics = self.opihi_solution.ephemeritics 

1428 

1429 # Update the rate text with the velocity terms provided by the 

1430 # propagation solution. The propagation solution provides rates as 

1431 # degrees per second. 

1432 ra_v_deg = ephemeritics.ra_velocity 

1433 dec_v_deg = ephemeritics.dec_velocity 

1434 # And acceleration, as degrees per second squared. 

1435 ra_a_deg = ephemeritics.ra_acceleration 

1436 dec_a_deg = ephemeritics.dec_acceleration 

1437 # Converting to the more familiar arcsec/s from deg/s along with 

1438 # arcsec/s/s from deg/s/s. Round after and prepare to make it a 

1439 # string for the GUI. 

1440 def vel_deg_to_arcsec_str(degree: float) -> str: 

1441 return str(round(degree * 3600, 5)) 

1442 

1443 def accl_deg_to_arcsec_str(degree: float) -> str: 

1444 # Accelerations are usually a lot less and thus should get their 

1445 # own method of manipulation. 

1446 return str("{acc:2.3e}".format(acc=degree)) 

1447 

1448 ra_v_arcsec_str = vel_deg_to_arcsec_str(ra_v_deg) 

1449 dec_v_arcsec_str = vel_deg_to_arcsec_str(dec_v_deg) 

1450 ra_a_arcsec_str = accl_deg_to_arcsec_str(ra_a_deg) 

1451 dec_a_arcsec_str = accl_deg_to_arcsec_str(dec_a_deg) 

1452 # Update the dynamic text. 

1453 self.ui.label_dynamic_ephemeris_ra_velocity.setText(ra_v_arcsec_str) 

1454 self.ui.label_dynamic_ephemeris_dec_velocity.setText(dec_v_arcsec_str) 

1455 self.ui.label_dynamic_ephemeris_ra_acceleration.setText(ra_a_arcsec_str) 

1456 self.ui.label_dynamic_ephemeris_dec_acceleration.setText(dec_a_arcsec_str) 

1457 

1458 # All done. 

1459 return None 

1460 

1461 def __refresh_dynamic_label_text_propagate(self) -> None: 

1462 """Refresh all of the dynamic label text for propagate. 

1463 This fills out the information based on the current solutions 

1464 available and solved. 

1465 

1466 A propagative solution must exist. 

1467 

1468 Parameters 

1469 ---------- 

1470 None 

1471 

1472 Returns 

1473 ------- 

1474 None 

1475 """ 

1476 # Everything in this function needs the OpihiSolution, if it does not 

1477 # exist, then exit early as there is nothing to refresh. 

1478 if not isinstance(self.opihi_solution, opihiexarata.OpihiSolution): 

1479 return None 

1480 else: 

1481 opihi_solution = self.opihi_solution 

1482 

1483 # Nothing so far. 

1484 pass 

1485 

1486 # Everything beyond this point requires an astrometric solution, if 

1487 # it does not exist, there is no point in continuing, exiting early. 

1488 if not isinstance( 

1489 self.opihi_solution.propagatives, propagate.PropagativeSolution 

1490 ): 

1491 return None 

1492 else: 

1493 propagatives = self.opihi_solution.propagatives 

1494 

1495 # Update the rate text with the velocity terms provided by the 

1496 # propagation solution. The propagation solution provides rates as 

1497 # degrees per second. 

1498 ra_v_deg = propagatives.ra_velocity 

1499 dec_v_deg = propagatives.dec_velocity 

1500 # And acceleration, as degrees per second squared. 

1501 ra_a_deg = propagatives.ra_acceleration 

1502 dec_a_deg = propagatives.dec_acceleration 

1503 # Converting to the more familiar arcsec/s from deg/s along with 

1504 # arcsec/s/s from deg/s/s. Round after and prepare to make it a 

1505 # string for the GUI. 

1506 def vel_deg_to_arcsec_str(degree: float) -> str: 

1507 return str(round(degree * 3600, 5)) 

1508 

1509 def accl_deg_to_arcsec_str(degree: float) -> str: 

1510 # Accelerations are usually a lot less and thus should get their 

1511 # own method of manipulation. 

1512 return str("{acc:2.3e}".format(acc=degree)) 

1513 

1514 ra_v_arcsec_str = vel_deg_to_arcsec_str(ra_v_deg) 

1515 dec_v_arcsec_str = vel_deg_to_arcsec_str(dec_v_deg) 

1516 ra_a_arcsec_str = accl_deg_to_arcsec_str(ra_a_deg) 

1517 dec_a_arcsec_str = accl_deg_to_arcsec_str(dec_a_deg) 

1518 # Update the dynamic text. 

1519 self.ui.label_dynamic_propagate_ra_velocity.setText(ra_v_arcsec_str) 

1520 self.ui.label_dynamic_propagate_dec_velocity.setText(dec_v_arcsec_str) 

1521 self.ui.label_dynamic_propagate_ra_acceleration.setText(ra_a_arcsec_str) 

1522 self.ui.label_dynamic_propagate_dec_acceleration.setText(dec_a_arcsec_str) 

1523 

1524 # Use the current time and date to determine the future positions with 

1525 # the time interval provided. 

1526 ENTRY_COUNT = library.config.GUI_MANUAL_PROPAGATE_FUTURE_COMPUTE_ENTRY_COUNT 

1527 INTERVAL = library.config.GUI_MANUAL_PROPAGATE_FUTURE_COMPUTE_TIMESTEP_SECONDS 

1528 INTERVAL_DAYS = INTERVAL / 86400 

1529 current_julian_day = library.conversion.current_utc_to_julian_day() 

1530 precomputed_future_text = "" 

1531 for countdex in range(int(ENTRY_COUNT)): 

1532 # The future Julian day time for this future, as the Julian time 

1533 # scale is in days. 

1534 future_julian_day = current_julian_day + INTERVAL_DAYS * countdex 

1535 # Converting this to the date and time string for this entry. 

1536 # As this is UNIX time, the date is in UTC or Zulu time. 

1537 yr, mh, dy, hr, mn, sc = library.conversion.julian_day_to_full_date( 

1538 jd=future_julian_day 

1539 ) 

1540 datetime_str = "{yr}-{mh}-{dy} {hr}:{mn}:{sc} Z".format( 

1541 yr=int(yr), mh=int(mh), dy=int(dy), hr=int(hr), mn=int(mn), sc=int(sc) 

1542 ) 

1543 # Using the Julian day time to compute the propagated solution for 

1544 # this time and formatting this as the needed string. 

1545 ra_deg, dec_deg = propagatives.forward_propagate( 

1546 future_time=future_julian_day 

1547 ) 

1548 ra_sex, dec_sex = library.conversion.degrees_to_sexagesimal_ra_dec( 

1549 ra_deg=ra_deg, dec_deg=dec_deg, precision=2 

1550 ) 

1551 ra_dec_str = "{ra} {dec}".format(ra=ra_sex, dec=dec_sex) 

1552 # The final format for this line per the GUI specification, just 

1553 # adding some space and the new line 

1554 entry_line = "{dt} | {rd} \n".format(dt=datetime_str, rd=ra_dec_str) 

1555 precomputed_future_text = precomputed_future_text + entry_line 

1556 # Set the text for the set of future solutions. 

1557 self.ui.text_browser_propagate_future_results.setPlainText( 

1558 precomputed_future_text 

1559 ) 

1560 

1561 # All done. 

1562 return None 

1563 

1564 def redraw_opihi_image(self) -> None: 

1565 """Redraw the Opihi image given that new results may have been added 

1566 because some solutions were completed. This modifies the GUI in-place. 

1567 

1568 Parameters 

1569 ---------- 

1570 None 

1571 

1572 Returns 

1573 ------- 

1574 None 

1575 """ 

1576 # Clear the information before re-plotting, it is easier just to draw 

1577 # it all again. 

1578 self.opihi_axes.clear() 

1579 

1580 # This is a function which allows for the disabling of other axes 

1581 # formatting their data values and messing with the formatter class. 

1582 def empty_string(string: str) -> str: 

1583 return str() 

1584 

1585 # These are points in future time which will be used to plot the 

1586 # ephemeris and propagation solutions, if they exist. However, 

1587 # as the time step is in seconds, and the standard time of this 

1588 # system is in Julian days, convert. 

1589 TIMESTEP_JD = ( 

1590 library.config.GUI_MANUAL_FUTURE_TIME_PLOT_TIMESTEP_SECONDS / 86400 

1591 ) 

1592 N_POINTS = library.config.GUI_MANUAL_FUTURE_TIME_PLOT_STEP_COUNT 

1593 # Numpy says linspace is more stable for decimal non-integer steps. 

1594 future_time_plot = np.linspace( 

1595 self.opihi_solution.observing_time, 

1596 self.opihi_solution.observing_time + TIMESTEP_JD * N_POINTS, 

1597 N_POINTS, 

1598 endpoint=True, 

1599 ) 

1600 

1601 # There is no solution and thus no image can be plotted. 

1602 if self.opihi_solution is None: 

1603 return None 

1604 

1605 # The data that will be plotted. 

1606 plotting_data = self.opihi_solution.data 

1607 # We set the bounds of the colorbar based on the 1-99 % bounds. 

1608 colorbar_low, colorbar_high = np.nanpercentile(plotting_data, [1, 99]) 

1609 # Plotting the image, should be in the background of everything. 

1610 image = self.opihi_axes.imshow( 

1611 plotting_data, cmap="gray", vmin=colorbar_low, vmax=colorbar_high, zorder=-3 

1612 ) 

1613 # Disable their formatting in favor of ours. 

1614 image.format_cursor_data = empty_string 

1615 

1616 # Attempt to plot the location of the specified asteroid. If this does 

1617 # not work, it is often because the location of the asteroid was not 

1618 # provided. 

1619 try: 

1620 target_x, target_y = self.opihi_solution.asteroid_location 

1621 target_marker = self.opihi_axes.scatter( 

1622 target_x, 

1623 target_y, 

1624 s=float(library.config.GUI_MANUAL_IMAGE_PLOT_TARGET_MARKER_SIZE), 

1625 marker="^", 

1626 color=str(library.config.GUI_MANUAL_IMAGE_PLOT_TARGET_MARKER_COLOR), 

1627 facecolors="None", 

1628 ) 

1629 # Disable their formatting in favor of ours. 

1630 target_marker.format_cursor_data = empty_string 

1631 except Exception: 

1632 # It does not work. 

1633 pass 

1634 

1635 # If there is an ephemeris solution, it is helpful to trace out the 

1636 # future path predicted by the ephemeris. 

1637 if isinstance(self.opihi_solution.ephemeritics, ephemeris.EphemeriticSolution): 

1638 # The astrometric solution is also needed to convert it back to 

1639 # pixel coordinates. As the ephemeritic solution requires the 

1640 # astrometric solution, this is fine. 

1641 astrometrics = self.opihi_solution.astrometrics 

1642 ephemeritics = self.opihi_solution.ephemeritics 

1643 # Find the future coordinates based on the future plot times 

1644 # from the configuration. 

1645 ephemeris_future_ra, ephemeris_future_dec = ephemeritics.forward_ephemeris( 

1646 future_time=future_time_plot 

1647 ) 

1648 # Converting to pixel locations. 

1649 ( 

1650 ephemeris_future_x, 

1651 ephemeris_future_y, 

1652 ) = astrometrics.sky_to_pixel_coordinates( 

1653 ra=ephemeris_future_ra, dec=ephemeris_future_dec 

1654 ) 

1655 # Plotting. 

1656 future_ephemeris_plot = self.opihi_axes.plot( 

1657 ephemeris_future_x, 

1658 ephemeris_future_y, 

1659 color=library.config.GUI_MANUAL_FUTURE_TIME_PLOT_EPHEMERIS_LINE_COLOR, 

1660 ) 

1661 # Disable their formatting in favor of ours. 

1662 future_ephemeris_plot[0].format_cursor_data = empty_string 

1663 

1664 # If there is a propagation solution, it is helpful to trace out the 

1665 # future path predicted by the propagation. 

1666 if isinstance(self.opihi_solution.propagatives, propagate.PropagativeSolution): 

1667 # The astrometric solution is also needed to convert it back to 

1668 # pixel coordinates. As the ephemeritic solution requires the 

1669 # astrometric solution, this is fine. 

1670 astrometrics = self.opihi_solution.astrometrics 

1671 propagatives = self.opihi_solution.propagatives 

1672 # Find the future coordinates based on the future plot times 

1673 # from the configuration. 

1674 propagate_future_ra, propagate_future_dec = propagatives.forward_propagate( 

1675 future_time=future_time_plot 

1676 ) 

1677 # Converting to pixel locations. 

1678 ( 

1679 propagate_future_x, 

1680 propagate_future_y, 

1681 ) = astrometrics.sky_to_pixel_coordinates( 

1682 ra=propagate_future_ra, dec=propagate_future_dec 

1683 ) 

1684 # Plotting. 

1685 future_propagate_plot = self.opihi_axes.plot( 

1686 propagate_future_x, 

1687 propagate_future_y, 

1688 color=library.config.GUI_MANUAL_FUTURE_TIME_PLOT_PROPAGATE_LINE_COLOR, 

1689 ) 

1690 # Disable their formatting in favor of ours. 

1691 future_propagate_plot[0].format_cursor_data = empty_string 

1692 

1693 # Make sure the coordinate formatter does not change. 

1694 self.opihi_axes.format_coord = self._opihi_coordinate_formatter 

1695 # Update and redraw the image via redrawing the canvas. 

1696 self.opihi_canvas.draw() 

1697 return None 

1698 

1699 def save_results(self) -> None: 

1700 """Save all of the results of the solutions to date. This is especially 

1701 done upon selecting a new image, the previous image results are 

1702 saved. 

1703 

1704 If there is no solution class, then there is no results to save either 

1705 and this function does nothing. 

1706 

1707 Parameters 

1708 ---------- 

1709 None 

1710 

1711 Returns 

1712 ------- 

1713 None 

1714 """ 

1715 # If there is no solution class, there is nothing to save. Exiting 

1716 # early. 

1717 if not isinstance(self.opihi_solution, opihiexarata.OpihiSolution): 

1718 return None 

1719 

1720 # There are two primary things to save, the image and solution 

1721 # information and the MPC record as retrievable historical data. 

1722 def _save_results_fits_image() -> None: 

1723 """First, doing the image data.""" 

1724 

1725 def _save_results_mpcrecord() -> None: 

1726 """Second, the MPC record historical data.""" 

1727 # The current record to add. 

1728 mpc_record = self.opihi_solution.mpc_record_row() 

1729 # Adding the new line character as write lines do not do this. 

1730 mpc_record = mpc_record + "\n" 

1731 # If the record file already exists, append this information to it. 

1732 with open(self.__get_mpc_record_filename(), "a") as mpcfile: 

1733 mpcfile.writelines([mpc_record]) 

1734 # All done. 

1735 return None 

1736 

1737 # Executing the saving functions. 

1738 _save_results_fits_image() 

1739 _save_results_mpcrecord() 

1740 # All done. 

1741 return None 

1742 

1743 

1744def start_manual_window() -> None: 

1745 """This is the function to create the manual window for usage. 

1746 

1747 Parameters 

1748 ---------- 

1749 None 

1750 

1751 Returns 

1752 ------- 

1753 None 

1754 """ 

1755 # Creating the application and its infrastructure. 

1756 app = QtWidgets.QApplication([]) 

1757 # The manual GUI window. 

1758 manual_window = OpihiManualWindow() 

1759 manual_window.show() 

1760 # Closing out of the window. 

1761 sys.exit(app.exec()) 

1762 # All done. 

1763 return None 

1764 

1765 

1766if __name__ == "__main__": 

1767 start_manual_window()
